definitions.definition: a game, etc. that you have to think about carefully in order to answer it or do it

examples.text: a book of puzzles for children

definitions.definition: something that is difficult to understand or explain

examples.text: The deeper meaning of the poem remains a puzzle.
The detectives were beginning to solve the murder. All the pieces of the puzzle were falling neatly into place.
The origin of the word is something of a puzzle.
The puzzle remains of what happened to the ship.
There is a puzzle about how the plant first came to Britain.
The police didn't know what the message meant, but it was another piece of the puzzle.
They're trying to solve the puzzle of how gravity works.
Traces of explosives found among the wreckage were the key to the puzzle.
They knew who the killer was, but there were still some gaps in the puzzle.

definitions.definition: a picture printed on cardboard (= very thick, stiff card) or wood, that has been cut up into a lot of small pieces of different shapes that you have to fit together again

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (as a verb): of unknown origin.
